comments:
I am running Eclipse 3.2M5a with WebTools 1.5M5. When WebTools attempts to publish my EAR to a BEA WebLogic 8.1 server, I receive the NPE listed below. My EAR has two dependent EJB modules and two dependent WEB modules. The EAR, EJB and WEB modules all have various external dependencies stored in a Maven repository.

!MESSAGE Could not publish to the server.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.append(Path.java:257)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.AbstractModuleAssembler.packModule(AbstractModuleAssembler.java:68)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.EarModuleAssembler.assemble(EarModuleAssembler.java:34)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.AntPublisher.assembleModule(AntPublisher.java:105)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.AntPublisher.publish(AntPublisher.java:92)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerBehavior.publishModule(GenericServerBehavior.java:61)
FYI, in my environment, this bug behaves exactly like previously resolved bug #125721.

Gorkem,

Is this bug still on target to be fixed for 1.5?

Thanks in advance for the update.

- Ron

Yes It is actually I was woking on it last week but sth tale priority. Until now I could not repro and also the line numbers in the stack trace do not match. It would be great if you can post a new stacktrace with a later build.
Ron I am having trouble reproducing this I have a workspace with 2 ejb and web modules in an ear with dependencies to utility modules. Could it be because of the dependencies in the maven?

I have dependencies to external jars from my ear. I also have dependencies to different external jars from the ejb and war modules within the ear. The ear module .component file references external jars like the following where MAVEN_REPO is a classpath variable:

<dependent-module deploy-path="/APP-INF/lib" handle="module:/classpath/var/MAVEN_REPO/xerces/jars/xmlParserAPIS-2.8.0.jar"> <dependency-type>uses</dependency-type></dependent-module>

The web module .component file references external jars similarly:

<dependent-module deploy-path="/WEB-INF/lib" handle="module:/classpath/var/MAVEN_REPO/jstl/jars/jstl-1.0.2.jar"> <dependency-type>uses</dependency-type></dependent-module>

FYI, I retested using WTP 1.5RC2 and experienced the exact same problem. Let me know if I can be of further assistance. 

- Ron

Here is the stacktrace using 1.5RC2:

!MESSAGE Could not publish to the server.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.append(Path.java:257)
at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.AbstractModuleAssembler.packModule(AbstractModuleAssembler.java:83)
at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.EarModuleAssembler.assemble(EarModuleAssembler.java:37)
at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.AntPublisher.assembleModule(AntPublisher.java:109)
at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.AntPublisher.publish(AntPublisher.java:94)
at
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerBehavior.publishModule(GenericServerBehavior.java:90)

FYI, this ear currently references ejb modules, web modules, and external jars. It does not reference any Java utility projects.

- Ron

Gorkem,

Have you had a chance to look at this yet?

- Ron
passing to j2ee IEnterpriseApplication.getUri(module) returns null.
Hey, what was the fix in 1.0.2?  What is the IModule you are passing to IEnterpriseApplication and asking for the URI?
John see the comment 5, it is the dependent modules that is causing the problem. Do we support classpath variables in .component file?

Hey Gorkem, yes we support class variables in the .component file however these files are handled by the deployable in the members() method, and not as a seperate child module.  So, on the EAR, getChildModules() will not return the external jars so there should be no need to ask the EAr for getURI() on the external jar module.

I do see these external jars being returned by the members() method properly.
This API is working as designed, it only returns URI's for J2EE modules, not for external JARs.  You should not need to access this API for those.
I can not repro this yet. Can you provide a workspace that has this problem.
Ron can you still reproduce this with a later build? Can you provide a workspace?
resolving please reopen if you still see the same behaviour.

Hi Gorkem,

My initial testing indicates that the problem is indeed fixed in RC4. I'll be able to definatively confirm in the next week or so. Thanks for your efforts.

- Ron
